solution_line_template: It takes Lara {first_time_minutes} minutes and {first_time_seconds_extra} seconds to make it through the obstacle course the first time. {first_time_minutes} minutes x {seconds_per_minute} seconds per minute = {minutes_to_seconds_first_part} seconds + {first_time_seconds_extra} seconds = <<{first_time_minutes}*{seconds_per_minute}+{first_time_seconds_extra}={first_part_total_seconds}>>{first_part_total_seconds} seconds to get through the first part of the obstacle course.

The second stage of the obstacle course she completes in {second_stage_seconds} seconds + {first_part_total_seconds} seconds = <<{second_stage_seconds}+{first_part_total_seconds}={total_after_second_stage}>>{total_after_second_stage} seconds.

It takes {second_time_minutes} minutes and {second_time_seconds_extra} seconds for Lara to get through the obstacle course the second time. {second_time_minutes} minutes x {seconds_per_minute} seconds per minute = {minutes_to_seconds_second_part} + {second_time_seconds_extra} seconds = <<{minutes_to_seconds_second_part}+{second_time_seconds_extra}={second_part_total_seconds}>>{second_part_total_seconds} seconds.

Combined, it takes Lara {total_after_second_stage} + {second_part_total_seconds} seconds = <<{total_after_second_stage}+{second_part_total_seconds}={total_obstacle_course_time}>>{total_obstacle_course_time} seconds for Lara to run the whole obstacle course.
